decision_conditions:
<p><span style="line-height: 115%;">The proposed
part single part two storey side to rear extension by reason of its excessive
combined size, width, scale, bulk, and massing, the proposed first floor side
and rear element’s insufficient set</span><span style="line-height: 115%; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;"> back from the southern
side boundary in conjunction with the lack of set back from the front elevation
and its prominent corner siting as well as the first floor side and rear
element’s lack of set in from the side elevation would </span><span style="line-height: 115%;">give rise to a disproportionate addition which
would fail to respect the proportions and character of the original building.
Furthermore, by virtue of its prominent corner siting the development would
appear unduly prominent, incongruous and dominant when viewed along the street
scene, at odds with the established pattern of development along the road.&nbsp; The proposed development would therefore be
contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy
Framework (2023), Policies D3.D(1) and D3.D(11) of The London Plan (2021),
Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 A, DM1 B (a), (b)
and (c) of the Development Management Plan Local Policies (2013) and the
Adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span><br></p>
description: Two storey side to rear extension; conversion of garage to habitable room; single storey rear extension; rear dormer; external alterations
